trans-unit.source: Apply Math Operation
trans-unit.target: Apply Math Operation

trans-unit.source: Applies a mathematical operation to column values
trans-unit.target: Applies a mathematical operation to column values

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="8A248CBA-24AA-4779-AAD6-35D73A0A2340" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Statistical Functions</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="8A248CBA-24AA-4779-AAD6-35D73A0A2340" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Statistical Functions</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Apply Math Operation</ui> module to create calculations to apply on some or all of the columns in the input dataset.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Apply Math Operation</ui> module to create calculations to apply on some or all of the columns in the input dataset.

trans-unit.source: Supported math operations include rounding, common arithmetic functions such as multiplication and division, trigonometric functions, various rounding functions, and special functions used in data science such as gamma and error functions.
trans-unit.target: Supported math operations include rounding, common arithmetic functions such as multiplication and division, trigonometric functions, various rounding functions, and special functions used in data science such as gamma and error functions.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Apply Math Operation</ui> module returns a dataset that includes the result of the specified calculations.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Apply Math Operation</ui> module returns a dataset that includes the result of the specified calculations.

trans-unit.source: You can opt to return the source columns with the results, output only the results, or replace the values in the columns that you select for the specified operation.
trans-unit.target: You can opt to return the source columns with the results, output only the results, or replace the values in the columns that you select for the specified operation.

trans-unit.source: Often several instances of the <ui>Apply Math Operation</ui> will be chained together to complete a complex operation on a column.
trans-unit.target: Often several instances of the <ui>Apply Math Operation</ui> will be chained together to complete a complex operation on a column.

trans-unit.source: Viewing some examples is the easiest way to see how to build mathematical formulas constructed using the module.
trans-unit.target: Viewing some examples is the easiest way to see how to build mathematical formulas constructed using the module.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: For examples of how to use <ui>Apply Math Operation</ui>, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how to use <ui>Apply Math Operation</ui>, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: In the <externalLink><linkText>Color quantization</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525272</linkUri></externalLink> sample, one set of column values is subtracted from another, and then the results are squared.
trans-unit.target: In the <externalLink><linkText>Color quantization</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525272</linkUri></externalLink> sample, one set of column values is subtracted from another, and then the results are squared.

trans-unit.source: In the <externalLink><linkText>Customer relationship prediction</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525941</linkUri></externalLink> sample, the constant 1 is added to all values in a column to distinguish between zeros and missing values.
trans-unit.target: In the <externalLink><linkText>Customer relationship prediction</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525941</linkUri></externalLink> sample, the constant 1 is added to all values in a column to distinguish between zeros and missing values.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Flight delay prediction</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525725</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates various operations, including rounding and division.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Flight delay prediction</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525725</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates various operations, including rounding and division.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Direct marketing</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525168</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses comparison operations to determine whether probability scores meet a required value.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Direct marketing</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525168</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses comparison operations to determine whether probability scores meet a required value.

trans-unit.source: How to Use Apply Math Operation
trans-unit.target: How to Use Apply Math Operation

trans-unit.source: Click the <ui>Category</ui> dropdown list, and choose a type of function:
trans-unit.target: Click the <ui>Category</ui> dropdown list, and choose a type of function:

trans-unit.source: Basic
trans-unit.target: Basic

trans-unit.source: Basic unary functions, such as absolute values, the value of pi, etc.
trans-unit.target: Basic unary functions, such as absolute values, the value of pi, etc.

trans-unit.source: Compare
trans-unit.target: Compare

trans-unit.source: Comparison operations
trans-unit.target: Comparison operations

trans-unit.source: Operations
trans-unit.target: Operations

trans-unit.source: Core arithmetic operations such as add and divide
trans-unit.target: Core arithmetic operations such as add and divide

trans-unit.source: Rounding
trans-unit.target: Rounding

trans-unit.source: Rounding and ceiling functions of all kinds
trans-unit.target: Rounding and ceiling functions of all kinds

trans-unit.source: Special mathematical functions
trans-unit.target: Special mathematical functions

trans-unit.source: Special mathematical functions
trans-unit.target: Special mathematical functions

trans-unit.source: Trigonometric functions
trans-unit.target: Trigonometric functions

trans-unit.source: Trigonometric functions
trans-unit.target: Trigonometric functions

trans-unit.source: Depending on the type of operation you choose, you will pick one or more columns and one or more constants to use in the operation.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the type of operation you choose, you will pick one or more columns and one or more constants to use in the operation.

trans-unit.source: Input columns must be numeric.
trans-unit.target: Input columns must be numeric.

trans-unit.source: Moreover, the range of data must be valid for the selected mathematical operation.
trans-unit.target: Moreover, the range of data must be valid for the selected mathematical operation.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise an error or NaN (not a number) result may occur.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise an error or NaN (not a number) result may occur.

trans-unit.source: For example, <math>Ln(-1.0)</math> is an invalid operation and results in <math>NaN</math>.
trans-unit.target: For example, <math>Ln(-1.0)</math> is an invalid operation and results in <math>NaN</math>.

trans-unit.source: Indicate whether you want the results to overwrite the current column, or be appended to the current dataset.
trans-unit.target: Indicate whether you want the results to overwrite the current column, or be appended to the current dataset.

trans-unit.source: You can also output just the results and ignore the rest of the datset.
trans-unit.target: You can also output just the results and ignore the rest of the datset.

trans-unit.source: Basic
trans-unit.target: Basic

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Basic</ui> category includes these core mathematical functions:
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Basic</ui> category includes these core mathematical functions:

trans-unit.source: Abs
trans-unit.target: Abs

trans-unit.source: Returns the absolute value.
trans-unit.target: Returns the absolute value.

trans-unit.source: This is a unary operation, so there are no parameters.
trans-unit.target: This is a unary operation, so there are no parameters.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.

trans-unit.source: Atan2
trans-unit.target: Atan2

trans-unit.source: Returns a four-quadrant inverse tangent.
trans-unit.target: Returns a four-quadrant inverse tangent.

trans-unit.source: Corresponds to the ATAN2 function in Matlab.
trans-unit.target: Corresponds to the ATAN2 function in Matlab.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to apply the operation to by using the <ui>ColumnSet</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to apply the operation to by using the <ui>ColumnSet</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: Specify another column or a constant to use in computing the value by selecting the <ui>Second argument type</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Specify another column or a constant to use in computing the value by selecting the <ui>Second argument type</ui>.

trans-unit.source: If the second argument is a column, select a single column with values to be used as the second argument.
trans-unit.target: If the second argument is a column, select a single column with values to be used as the second argument.

trans-unit.source: If the second argument is a constant, type the value in the <ui>Constant second argument</ui> text box.
trans-unit.target: If the second argument is a constant, type the value in the <ui>Constant second argument</ui> text box.

trans-unit.source: Conj
trans-unit.target: Conj

trans-unit.source: Create the conjugate for the current value.
trans-unit.target: Create the conjugate for the current value.

trans-unit.source: This is a unary operation, so there are no parameters.
trans-unit.target: This is a unary operation, so there are no parameters.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.

trans-unit.source: CubeRoot
trans-unit.target: CubeRoot

trans-unit.source: Calculate the cube root for the current value.
trans-unit.target: Calculate the cube root for the current value.

trans-unit.source: This is a unary operation, so there are no parameters.
trans-unit.target: This is a unary operation, so there are no parameters.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.

trans-unit.source: DoubleFactorial
trans-unit.target: DoubleFactorial

trans-unit.source: Calculate the double factorial for the current value.
trans-unit.target: Calculate the double factorial for the current value.

trans-unit.source: The double factorial is an extension of the normal factorial function, and it is denoted as <math>x!!</math>.
trans-unit.target: The double factorial is an extension of the normal factorial function, and it is denoted as <math>x!!</math>.

trans-unit.source: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.
trans-unit.target: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.

trans-unit.source: Eps
trans-unit.target: Eps

trans-unit.source: Returns the size of the gap between the current value and the next-highest, double-precision number.
trans-unit.target: Returns the size of the gap between the current value and the next-highest, double-precision number.

trans-unit.source: Corresponds to the EPS function in Matlab.
trans-unit.target: Corresponds to the EPS function in Matlab.

trans-unit.source: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.
trans-unit.target: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.

trans-unit.source: Exp
trans-unit.target: Exp

trans-unit.source: Returns the exponential for each value in the column.
trans-unit.target: Returns the exponential for each value in the column.

trans-unit.source: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.
trans-unit.target: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.

trans-unit.source: Exp2
trans-unit.target: Exp2

trans-unit.source: Returns the base-2 exponential of the argument.
trans-unit.target: Returns the base-2 exponential of the argument.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to apply the operation to by using the <ui>ColumnSet</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to apply the operation to by using the <ui>ColumnSet</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: Specify another column or a constant to use in computing the function by selecting the <ui>Second argument type</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Specify another column or a constant to use in computing the function by selecting the <ui>Second argument type</ui>.

trans-unit.source: If the second argument is a column, select a single column with values to be used as the second argument.
trans-unit.target: If the second argument is a column, select a single column with values to be used as the second argument.

trans-unit.source: If the second argument is a constant, type the value in the <ui>Constant second argument</ui> text box.
trans-unit.target: If the second argument is a constant, type the value in the <ui>Constant second argument</ui> text box.

trans-unit.source: ExpMinus1
trans-unit.target: ExpMinus1

trans-unit.source: Returns the negative exponent.
trans-unit.target: Returns the negative exponent.

trans-unit.source: Factorial
trans-unit.target: Factorial

trans-unit.source: Returns the factorial for the specified number.
trans-unit.target: Returns the factorial for the specified number.

trans-unit.source: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.
trans-unit.target: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.

trans-unit.source: Hypotenuse
trans-unit.target: Hypotenuse

trans-unit.source: Calculates the hypotenuse given the current column and the supplied arguments.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the hypotenuse given the current column and the supplied arguments.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to apply the operation to by using the <ui>ColumnSet</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to apply the operation to by using the <ui>ColumnSet</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: Specify another column or a constant to use in computing the function by selecting the <ui>Second argument type</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Specify another column or a constant to use in computing the function by selecting the <ui>Second argument type</ui>.

trans-unit.source: If the second argument is a column, select a single column with values to be used as the second argument.
trans-unit.target: If the second argument is a column, select a single column with values to be used as the second argument.

trans-unit.source: If the second argument is a constant, type the value in the <ui>Constant second argument</ui> text box.
trans-unit.target: If the second argument is a constant, type the value in the <ui>Constant second argument</ui> text box.

trans-unit.source: ImaginaryPart
trans-unit.target: ImaginaryPart

trans-unit.source: Returns the imaginary part of the values in the selected column.
trans-unit.target: Returns the imaginary part of the values in the selected column.

trans-unit.source: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.
trans-unit.target: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.

trans-unit.source: Ln
trans-unit.target: Ln

trans-unit.source: Returns the natural logarithm.
trans-unit.target: Returns the natural logarithm.

trans-unit.source: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.
trans-unit.target: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.

trans-unit.source: LnPlus1
trans-unit.target: LnPlus1

trans-unit.source: Returns the natural logarithm plus one.
trans-unit.target: Returns the natural logarithm plus one.

trans-unit.source: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.
trans-unit.target: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.

trans-unit.source: Log
trans-unit.target: Log

trans-unit.source: Returns the log of the values in the selected column, given the specified base.
trans-unit.target: Returns the log of the values in the selected column, given the specified base.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to apply the operation to by using the <ui>ColumnSet</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to apply the operation to by using the <ui>ColumnSet</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: Specify another column that contains base values, or specify a constant to use as a base by selecting from <ui>Second argument type</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Specify another column that contains base values, or specify a constant to use as a base by selecting from <ui>Second argument type</ui>.

trans-unit.source: If the second argument is a column, each value in the column is used as the log base for the corresponding row.
trans-unit.target: If the second argument is a column, each value in the column is used as the log base for the corresponding row.

trans-unit.source: If the second argument is a constant, type the base value in the <ui>Constant second argument</ui> text box.
trans-unit.target: If the second argument is a constant, type the base value in the <ui>Constant second argument</ui> text box.

trans-unit.source: Log10
trans-unit.target: Log10

trans-unit.source: Returns the base 10 logarithm.
trans-unit.target: Returns the base 10 logarithm.

trans-unit.source: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.
trans-unit.target: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.

trans-unit.source: Log2
trans-unit.target: Log2

trans-unit.source: Returns the base 2 logarithm.
trans-unit.target: Returns the base 2 logarithm.

trans-unit.source: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.
trans-unit.target: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.

trans-unit.source: NthRoot
trans-unit.target: NthRoot

trans-unit.source: Returns the nth root of the value, using an <math>n</math> that you specify.
trans-unit.target: Returns the nth root of the value, using an <math>n</math> that you specify.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to apply the operation to, by using the <ui>ColumnSet</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to apply the operation to, by using the <ui>ColumnSet</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: Specify another column that contains the root, or specify a constant to use as the root by selecting from <ui>Second argument type</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Specify another column that contains the root, or specify a constant to use as the root by selecting from <ui>Second argument type</ui>.

trans-unit.source: If the second argument is a column, each value in the column is used as the value of <math>n</math> for the corresponding row.
trans-unit.target: If the second argument is a column, each value in the column is used as the value of <math>n</math> for the corresponding row.

trans-unit.source: If the second argument is a constant, type the value for <math>n</math> in the <ui>Constant second argument</ui> text box.
trans-unit.target: If the second argument is a constant, type the value for <math>n</math> in the <ui>Constant second argument</ui> text box.

trans-unit.source: Pow
trans-unit.target: Pow

trans-unit.source: Calculates <math>X</math> raised to the power of <math>Y</math>.
trans-unit.target: Calculates <math>X</math> raised to the power of <math>Y</math>.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns that contains the base (which should be a float) by using the <ui>ColumnSet</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns that contains the base (which should be a float) by using the <ui>ColumnSet</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: Specify another column that contains the exponent, or specify a constant to use as the exponent by selecting from <ui>Second argument type</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Specify another column that contains the exponent, or specify a constant to use as the exponent by selecting from <ui>Second argument type</ui>.

trans-unit.source: If the second argument is a column, each value in the column is used as the exponent for the corresponding row.
trans-unit.target: If the second argument is a column, each value in the column is used as the exponent for the corresponding row.

trans-unit.source: If the second argument is a constant, type the value for the exponent in the <ui>Constant second argument</ui> text box.
trans-unit.target: If the second argument is a constant, type the value for the exponent in the <ui>Constant second argument</ui> text box.

trans-unit.source: RealPart
trans-unit.target: RealPart

trans-unit.source: Returns the real part of the values in the column.
trans-unit.target: Returns the real part of the values in the column.

trans-unit.source: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.
trans-unit.target: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.

trans-unit.source: Sqrt
trans-unit.target: Sqrt

trans-unit.source: Returns the square root of the values in the column.
trans-unit.target: Returns the square root of the values in the column.

trans-unit.source: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.
trans-unit.target: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.

trans-unit.source: SqrtPi
trans-unit.target: SqrtPi

trans-unit.source: Returns the square root of (number * pi).
trans-unit.target: Returns the square root of (number * pi).

trans-unit.source: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.
trans-unit.target: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.

trans-unit.source: Square
trans-unit.target: Square

trans-unit.source: Squares the values in the column.
trans-unit.target: Squares the values in the column.

trans-unit.source: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.
trans-unit.target: This is a unary operation so there are no parameters.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to which the operation should apply.

trans-unit.source: Compare
trans-unit.target: Compare

trans-unit.source: Select one of the comparison operations to apply.
trans-unit.target: Select one of the comparison operations to apply.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might decide to compare the results of evaluating a model against a threshold, represented as a constant, and generate TRUE/FALSE flags to indicate which rows were greater than the threshold value.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might decide to compare the results of evaluating a model against a threshold, represented as a constant, and generate TRUE/FALSE flags to indicate which rows were greater than the threshold value.

trans-unit.source: Or you might want to check whether the values in two columns matched.
trans-unit.target: Or you might want to check whether the values in two columns matched.

trans-unit.source: These operations are all binary operations, so you need to specify a column or columns of values, and choose a constant or another column to use for comparison.
trans-unit.target: These operations are all binary operations, so you need to specify a column or columns of values, and choose a constant or another column to use for comparison.

trans-unit.source: The headings of the returned dataset indicate the operation and the columns that were used, for example:
trans-unit.target: The headings of the returned dataset indicate the operation and the columns that were used, for example:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Equals(Col2_Col1)</embeddedLabel> indicates that you tested Col2 against Col1.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Equals(Col2_Col1)</embeddedLabel> indicates that you tested Col2 against Col1.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Equals(Col2_$10)</embeddedLabel> indicates that you chose a constant to use in comparison.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Equals(Col2_$10)</embeddedLabel> indicates that you chose a constant to use in comparison.

trans-unit.source: Both columns that you compare must be in the same dataset.
trans-unit.target: Both columns that you compare must be in the same dataset.

trans-unit.source: To compare two values or sets of values
trans-unit.target: To compare two values or sets of values

trans-unit.source: Choose the type of the first comparison set by using the <ui>Value to compare type</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: Choose the type of the first comparison set by using the <ui>Value to compare type</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: If you want to compare two sets of column values, choose <ui>ColumnSet</ui>, and then use the <ui>Column Selector</ui> to choose the first column or columns.
trans-unit.target: If you want to compare two sets of column values, choose <ui>ColumnSet</ui>, and then use the <ui>Column Selector</ui> to choose the first column or columns.

trans-unit.source: If you want to compare the values in the column or columns against a constant, select <ui>Constant</ui>, and then type the value in the <ui>Constant value to compare</ui> text box.
trans-unit.target: If you want to compare the values in the column or columns against a constant, select <ui>Constant</ui>, and then type the value in the <ui>Constant value to compare</ui> text box.

trans-unit.source: EqualTo
trans-unit.target: EqualTo

trans-unit.source: Returns True if the values are the same, and returns False if they are not.
trans-unit.target: Returns True if the values are the same, and returns False if they are not.

trans-unit.source: GreaterThan
trans-unit.target: GreaterThan

trans-unit.source: Returns True if the values in <ui>Column set</ui> are greater than the constant or comparison column, and returns False if they are not.
trans-unit.target: Returns True if the values in <ui>Column set</ui> are greater than the constant or comparison column, and returns False if they are not.

trans-unit.source: GreaterThanOrEqualTo
trans-unit.target: GreaterThanOrEqualTo

trans-unit.source: Returns True if the values in <ui>Column set</ui> are greater than or equal to the constant or comparison column, and returns False if they are not.
trans-unit.target: Returns True if the values in <ui>Column set</ui> are greater than or equal to the constant or comparison column, and returns False if they are not.

trans-unit.source: LessThan
trans-unit.target: LessThan

trans-unit.source: Returns True if the values in <ui>Column set</ui> are less than the constant or comparison column, and returns False if they are not.
trans-unit.target: Returns True if the values in <ui>Column set</ui> are less than the constant or comparison column, and returns False if they are not.

trans-unit.source: LessThanOrEqualTo
trans-unit.target: LessThanOrEqualTo

trans-unit.source: Returns True if the values in <ui>Column set</ui> are less than or equal to the constant or comparison column, and returns False if they are not.
trans-unit.target: Returns True if the values in <ui>Column set</ui> are less than or equal to the constant or comparison column, and returns False if they are not.

trans-unit.source: NotEqualTo
trans-unit.target: NotEqualTo

trans-unit.source: Returns True if the values in <ui>Column set</ui> are not equal to the constant or comparison column, and returns False if they are equal.
trans-unit.target: Returns True if the values in <ui>Column set</ui> are not equal to the constant or comparison column, and returns False if they are equal.

trans-unit.source: PairMax
trans-unit.target: PairMax

trans-unit.source: Returns the value that is greaterthe value in <ui>Column set</ui> or the value in the constant or comparison column.
trans-unit.target: Returns the value that is greaterthe value in <ui>Column set</ui> or the value in the constant or comparison column.

trans-unit.source: PairMin
trans-unit.target: PairMin

trans-unit.source: Returns the value that is lessthe value in <ui>Column set</ui> or the value in the constant or comparison column
trans-unit.target: Returns the value that is lessthe value in <ui>Column set</ui> or the value in the constant or comparison column

trans-unit.source: Operations
trans-unit.target: Operations

trans-unit.source: This group includes basic arithmetic operations.
trans-unit.target: This group includes basic arithmetic operations.

trans-unit.source: You can chain them together to create calculations and modify dataset values en masse.
trans-unit.target: You can chain them together to create calculations and modify dataset values en masse.

trans-unit.source: To create a formula by using arithmetic operations
trans-unit.target: To create a formula by using arithmetic operations

trans-unit.source: Choose the columns to operate on by using the <ui>Column set</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: Choose the columns to operate on by using the <ui>Column set</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: Choose the number or column values to use as argument to the operator by selecting an <ui>Operation argument type</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Choose the number or column values to use as argument to the operator by selecting an <ui>Operation argument type</ui>.

trans-unit.source: If you want to compare the values in the column or columns against a constant, select <ui>Constant</ui> and then type the value in the <ui>Constant value to compare</ui> text box.
trans-unit.target: If you want to compare the values in the column or columns against a constant, select <ui>Constant</ui> and then type the value in the <ui>Constant value to compare</ui> text box.

trans-unit.source: To use another column of values as the argument to the operator, select <ui>ColumnSet</ui>, and then use the <ui>Column Selector</ui> to choose the column used as <ui>Operation argument</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To use another column of values as the argument to the operator, select <ui>ColumnSet</ui>, and then use the <ui>Column Selector</ui> to choose the column used as <ui>Operation argument</ui>.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might add two columns by using one instance of <ui>Apply Math Operation</ui>, and then use another instance of <ui>Apply Math Operation</ui> to divide the sum by a constant to obtain the mean.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might add two columns by using one instance of <ui>Apply Math Operation</ui>, and then use another instance of <ui>Apply Math Operation</ui> to divide the sum by a constant to obtain the mean.

trans-unit.source: Add
trans-unit.target: Add

trans-unit.source: Adds a constant or the column values defined in <ui>Operation argument</ui> to the values in the column that is specified by <ui>Column set</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Adds a constant or the column values defined in <ui>Operation argument</ui> to the values in the column that is specified by <ui>Column set</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Divide
trans-unit.target: Divide

trans-unit.source: Multiplies the values in <ui>Column set</ui> by the specified constant or column values.
trans-unit.target: Multiplies the values in <ui>Column set</ui> by the specified constant or column values.

trans-unit.source: Multiply
trans-unit.target: Multiply

trans-unit.source: Divides the values in <ui>Column set</ui> by a constant or by the column values defined in <ui>Operation argument</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Divides the values in <ui>Column set</ui> by a constant or by the column values defined in <ui>Operation argument</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Subtract
trans-unit.target: Subtract

trans-unit.source: Subtracts the specified constant or column values from the values in <ui>Column set</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Subtracts the specified constant or column values from the values in <ui>Column set</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Rounding
trans-unit.target: Rounding

trans-unit.source: Select a type of rounding operation to apply to the selected columns.
trans-unit.target: Select a type of rounding operation to apply to the selected columns.

trans-unit.source: For most rounding operations, you must specify a precision value by one of these methods:
trans-unit.target: For most rounding operations, you must specify a precision value by one of these methods:

trans-unit.source: Setting <ui>Precision Type</ui> to <ui>ColumnSet</ui> and choosing a column with appropriate values.
trans-unit.target: Setting <ui>Precision Type</ui> to <ui>ColumnSet</ui> and choosing a column with appropriate values.

trans-unit.source: Setting <ui>Precision Type</ui> to <ui>Constant</ui> and typing a value in the <ui>Constant Precision</ui> text box.
trans-unit.target: Setting <ui>Precision Type</ui> to <ui>Constant</ui> and typing a value in the <ui>Constant Precision</ui> text box.

trans-unit.source: Ceiling
trans-unit.target: Ceiling

trans-unit.source: Returns the ceiling for the values in <ui>Column set</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Returns the ceiling for the values in <ui>Column set</ui>.

trans-unit.source: CeilingPower2
trans-unit.target: CeilingPower2

trans-unit.source: Returns the squared ceiling for the values in <ui>Column set</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Returns the squared ceiling for the values in <ui>Column set</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Floor
trans-unit.target: Floor

trans-unit.source: Returns the floor for the values in <ui>Column set</ui>, to the specified precision.
trans-unit.target: Returns the floor for the values in <ui>Column set</ui>, to the specified precision.

trans-unit.source: Mod
trans-unit.target: Mod

trans-unit.source: Returns the fractional part of the values in <ui>Column set</ui>, to the specified precision.
trans-unit.target: Returns the fractional part of the values in <ui>Column set</ui>, to the specified precision.

trans-unit.source: Quotient
trans-unit.target: Quotient

trans-unit.source: Returns the fractional part of the values in <ui>Column set</ui>, to the specified precision.
trans-unit.target: Returns the fractional part of the values in <ui>Column set</ui>, to the specified precision.

trans-unit.source: Remainder
trans-unit.target: Remainder

trans-unit.source: Returns the remainder for the values in <ui>Column set</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Returns the remainder for the values in <ui>Column set</ui>.

trans-unit.source: RoundDigits
trans-unit.target: RoundDigits

trans-unit.source: Returns the values in <ui>Column set</ui>, rounded by the 4/5 rule to the specified number of digits.
trans-unit.target: Returns the values in <ui>Column set</ui>, rounded by the 4/5 rule to the specified number of digits.

trans-unit.source: RoundDown
trans-unit.target: RoundDown

trans-unit.source: Returns the values in <ui>Column set</ui>, rounded down to the specified number of digits.
trans-unit.target: Returns the values in <ui>Column set</ui>, rounded down to the specified number of digits.

trans-unit.source: RoundUp
trans-unit.target: RoundUp

trans-unit.source: Returns the values in <ui>Column set</ui>, rounded up to the specified number of digits.
trans-unit.target: Returns the values in <ui>Column set</ui>, rounded up to the specified number of digits.

trans-unit.source: ToEven
trans-unit.target: ToEven

trans-unit.source: Returns the values in <ui>Column set</ui>, rounded to the nearest whole, even number.
trans-unit.target: Returns the values in <ui>Column set</ui>, rounded to the nearest whole, even number.

trans-unit.source: ToOdd
trans-unit.target: ToOdd

trans-unit.source: Returns the values in <ui>Column set</ui>, rounded to the nearest whole, odd number.
trans-unit.target: Returns the values in <ui>Column set</ui>, rounded to the nearest whole, odd number.

trans-unit.source: Truncate
trans-unit.target: Truncate

trans-unit.source: Truncates the values in <ui>Column set</ui> by removing all digits not allowed by the specified precision.
trans-unit.target: Truncates the values in <ui>Column set</ui> by removing all digits not allowed by the specified precision.

trans-unit.source: Special
trans-unit.target: Special

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning Studio provides these special mathematical functions.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning Studio provides these special mathematical functions.

trans-unit.source: All operations are unary on the elected columns unless specifically noted.
trans-unit.target: All operations are unary on the elected columns unless specifically noted.

trans-unit.source: Beta
trans-unit.target: Beta

trans-unit.source: Returns the value of Eulers beta function.
trans-unit.target: Returns the value of Eulers beta function.

trans-unit.source: EllipticIntegralE
trans-unit.target: EllipticIntegralE

trans-unit.source: Returns the value of the incomplete elliptic integral .
trans-unit.target: Returns the value of the incomplete elliptic integral .

trans-unit.source: Specify a constant or column of values to apply as an argument.
trans-unit.target: Specify a constant or column of values to apply as an argument.

trans-unit.source: EllipticIntegralK
trans-unit.target: EllipticIntegralK

trans-unit.source: Returns the value of the complete elliptic integral (K).
trans-unit.target: Returns the value of the complete elliptic integral (K).

trans-unit.source: Specify a constant or column of values to apply as an argument.
trans-unit.target: Specify a constant or column of values to apply as an argument.

trans-unit.source: Erf
trans-unit.target: Erf

trans-unit.source: Returns the value of the error function.
trans-unit.target: Returns the value of the error function.

trans-unit.source: The error function (also called the Gauss error function) is a special function of the sigmoid shape that is used in probability to describe diffusion.
trans-unit.target: The error function (also called the Gauss error function) is a special function of the sigmoid shape that is used in probability to describe diffusion.

trans-unit.source: Erfc
trans-unit.target: Erfc

trans-unit.source: Returns the value of the complementary error function.
trans-unit.target: Returns the value of the complementary error function.

trans-unit.source: Erfc is defined as <math>1 erf(x)</math>.
trans-unit.target: Erfc is defined as <math>1 erf(x)</math>.

trans-unit.source: ErfScaled
trans-unit.target: ErfScaled

trans-unit.source: Returns the value of the scaled error function.
trans-unit.target: Returns the value of the scaled error function.

trans-unit.source: The scaled version of the error function can be used to avoid arithmetic underflow.
trans-unit.target: The scaled version of the error function can be used to avoid arithmetic underflow.

trans-unit.source: ErfInverse
trans-unit.target: ErfInverse

trans-unit.source: Returns the value of the inverse erf function.
trans-unit.target: Returns the value of the inverse erf function.

trans-unit.source: ExponentialIntegralEin
trans-unit.target: ExponentialIntegralEin

trans-unit.source: Returns the value of the exponential integral <math>Ei</math>.
trans-unit.target: Returns the value of the exponential integral <math>Ei</math>.

trans-unit.source: Gamma
trans-unit.target: Gamma

trans-unit.source: Returns the value of the gamma function.
trans-unit.target: Returns the value of the gamma function.

trans-unit.source: GammaLn
trans-unit.target: GammaLn

trans-unit.source: Returns the natural logarithm of the gamma function.
trans-unit.target: Returns the natural logarithm of the gamma function.

trans-unit.source: GammaRegularizedP
trans-unit.target: GammaRegularizedP

trans-unit.source: Returns the value of the regularized incomplete gamma function.
trans-unit.target: Returns the value of the regularized incomplete gamma function.

trans-unit.source: Specify a constant or column of values to apply as an argument.
trans-unit.target: Specify a constant or column of values to apply as an argument.

trans-unit.source: GammaRegularizedPInverse
trans-unit.target: GammaRegularizedPInverse

trans-unit.source: Returns the value of the inverse regularized incomplete gamma function.
trans-unit.target: Returns the value of the inverse regularized incomplete gamma function.

trans-unit.source: Specify a constant or column of values to apply as an argument.
trans-unit.target: Specify a constant or column of values to apply as an argument.

trans-unit.source: GammaRegularizedQ
trans-unit.target: GammaRegularizedQ

trans-unit.source: Returns the value of the regularized incomplete gamma function.
trans-unit.target: Returns the value of the regularized incomplete gamma function.

trans-unit.source: Specify a constant or column of values to apply as an argument.
trans-unit.target: Specify a constant or column of values to apply as an argument.

trans-unit.source: GammaRegularizedQInverse
trans-unit.target: GammaRegularizedQInverse

trans-unit.source: Returns the value of the inverse generalized regularized incomplete gamma function.
trans-unit.target: Returns the value of the inverse generalized regularized incomplete gamma function.

trans-unit.source: Specify a constant or column of values to apply as an argument.
trans-unit.target: Specify a constant or column of values to apply as an argument.

trans-unit.source: PolyGamma
trans-unit.target: PolyGamma

trans-unit.source: Returns the value of the polygamma function.
trans-unit.target: Returns the value of the polygamma function.

trans-unit.source: Specify a constant or column of values to apply as an argument.
trans-unit.target: Specify a constant or column of values to apply as an argument.

trans-unit.source: Trigonometric
trans-unit.target: Trigonometric

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning Studio provides the following trigonometric functions.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning Studio provides the following trigonometric functions.

trans-unit.source: All trigonometric functions are unary and require no additional arguments.
trans-unit.target: All trigonometric functions are unary and require no additional arguments.

trans-unit.source: Asech
trans-unit.target: Asech

trans-unit.source: Calculates the arcsecant of the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the arcsecant of the argument.

trans-unit.source: Asin
trans-unit.target: Asin

trans-unit.source: Calculates the arcsecant of the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the arcsecant of the argument.

trans-unit.source: AsinDegrees
trans-unit.target: AsinDegrees

trans-unit.source: Calculates the arcsine in degrees of the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the arcsine in degrees of the argument.

trans-unit.source: Asinh
trans-unit.target: Asinh

trans-unit.source: Calculates the arcsine in degrees for the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the arcsine in degrees for the argument.

trans-unit.source: Atan
trans-unit.target: Atan

trans-unit.source: Calculates the arctangent of the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the arctangent of the argument.

trans-unit.source: AtanDegrees
trans-unit.target: AtanDegrees

trans-unit.source: Calculates the arctangent in degrees of the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the arctangent in degrees of the argument.

trans-unit.source: Atanh
trans-unit.target: Atanh

trans-unit.source: Calculates the hyperbolic arctangent of the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the hyperbolic arctangent of the argument.

trans-unit.source: Cis
trans-unit.target: Cis

trans-unit.source: Returns the lesser of two numbers.
trans-unit.target: Returns the lesser of two numbers.

trans-unit.source: Cos
trans-unit.target: Cos

trans-unit.source: Calculates the cosine of the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the cosine of the argument.

trans-unit.source: CosDegrees
trans-unit.target: CosDegrees

trans-unit.source: Calculates the cosine in degrees for the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the cosine in degrees for the argument.

trans-unit.source: Coth
trans-unit.target: Coth

trans-unit.source: Calculates the hyperbolic cotangent for the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the hyperbolic cotangent for the argument.

trans-unit.source: Csc
trans-unit.target: Csc

trans-unit.source: Calculates the cosecant for the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the cosecant for the argument.

trans-unit.source: CscDegrees
trans-unit.target: CscDegrees

trans-unit.source: Calculates the cosecant in degrees for the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the cosecant in degrees for the argument.

trans-unit.source: Csch
trans-unit.target: Csch

trans-unit.source: Calculates the hyperbolic cosecant for the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the hyperbolic cosecant for the argument.

trans-unit.source: DegreestoRadians
trans-unit.target: DegreestoRadians

trans-unit.source: Converts degrees to radians.
trans-unit.target: Converts degrees to radians.

trans-unit.source: Sec
trans-unit.target: Sec

trans-unit.source: Calculates the secant of the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the secant of the argument.

trans-unit.source: SecDegrees
trans-unit.target: SecDegrees

trans-unit.source: Calculates the secant in degrees for the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the secant in degrees for the argument.

trans-unit.source: Sech
trans-unit.target: Sech

trans-unit.source: Calculates the hyperbolic secant of the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the hyperbolic secant of the argument.

trans-unit.source: Sign
trans-unit.target: Sign

trans-unit.source: Returns the sign of the value.
trans-unit.target: Returns the sign of the value.

trans-unit.source: Sin
trans-unit.target: Sin

trans-unit.source: Calculates the sine of the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the sine of the argument.

trans-unit.source: Sinc
trans-unit.target: Sinc

trans-unit.source: Calculates the sine-cosine value of the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the sine-cosine value of the argument.

trans-unit.target: SinDegrees

trans-unit.source: Calculates the sine in degrees for the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the sine in degrees for the argument.

trans-unit.source: Sinh
trans-unit.target: Sinh

trans-unit.source: Calculates the hyperbolic sine of the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the hyperbolic sine of the argument.

trans-unit.source: Tan
trans-unit.target: Tan

trans-unit.source: Calculates the tangent of the argument.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the tangent of the argument.

trans-unit.target: TanDegrees

trans-unit.source: Technical Notes
trans-unit.target: Technical Notes

trans-unit.source: Unary vs. Binary Operations
trans-unit.target: Unary vs. Binary Operations

trans-unit.source: The math functions in <ui>Apply Math Operation</ui> can be classified as either unary or binary operations:
trans-unit.target: The math functions in <ui>Apply Math Operation</ui> can be classified as either unary or binary operations:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Unary operations</embeddedLabel>: You modify the values in a single column without referring to other columns or constants.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Unary operations</embeddedLabel>: You modify the values in a single column without referring to other columns or constants.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might truncate the columns values to a certain degree of precision, round values up or down, or find ceiling or floor values.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might truncate the columns values to a certain degree of precision, round values up or down, or find ceiling or floor values.

trans-unit.source: An example of a unary operation is <codeInline>Abs(X)</codeInline>, where X is the column that is provided as input.
trans-unit.target: An example of a unary operation is <codeInline>Abs(X)</codeInline>, where X is the column that is provided as input.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Binary operations</embeddedLabel>: You choose two pairs of values or columns, and the result is computed for each row in the column.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Binary operations</embeddedLabel>: You choose two pairs of values or columns, and the result is computed for each row in the column.

trans-unit.source: An example of a binary operation that uses two columns is <codeInline>Subtract(X,Y)</codeInline>, in which X is the first column you select, and Y is the second column.
trans-unit.target: An example of a binary operation that uses two columns is <codeInline>Subtract(X,Y)</codeInline>, in which X is the first column you select, and Y is the second column.

trans-unit.source: An example of using a binary operation that combines a column and a constant might be <codeInline>Subtract(X,mean)</codeInline>, where you type the column mean as a constant and subtract it from each value in column X.
trans-unit.target: An example of using a binary operation that combines a column and a constant might be <codeInline>Subtract(X,mean)</codeInline>, where you type the column mean as a constant and subtract it from each value in column X.

trans-unit.source: Categorical Columns
trans-unit.target: Categorical Columns

trans-unit.source: For categorical columns, a unary operation is applied not only to column data, but also to categorical data values.
trans-unit.target: For categorical columns, a unary operation is applied not only to column data, but also to categorical data values.

trans-unit.source: If a unary operation is applied to a categorical column, different categorical data values of input column can be transformed to equal associated categorical data values of the output column.
trans-unit.target: If a unary operation is applied to a categorical column, different categorical data values of input column can be transformed to equal associated categorical data values of the output column.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the values are merged and the number of categorical data values in the output becomes less than the number in the input.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the values are merged and the number of categorical data values in the output becomes less than the number in the input.

trans-unit.source: If a binary operation is applied to a categorical column and some other column, the behavior of the module is as follows:
trans-unit.target: If a binary operation is applied to a categorical column and some other column, the behavior of the module is as follows:

trans-unit.source: If the other column is dense, the output column is categorical.
trans-unit.target: If the other column is dense, the output column is categorical.

trans-unit.source: Categorical data values presented in the input are lost.
trans-unit.target: Categorical data values presented in the input are lost.

trans-unit.source: The output column has only those values that are present in the output column data.
trans-unit.target: The output column has only those values that are present in the output column data.

trans-unit.source: If the other column is sparse, the output column is sparse.
trans-unit.target: If the other column is sparse, the output column is sparse.

trans-unit.source: If both arguments of a binary operation are sparse columns, the resulting column contains background zeros in all positions where both input columns contained background zeros.
trans-unit.target: If both arguments of a binary operation are sparse columns, the resulting column contains background zeros in all positions where both input columns contained background zeros.

trans-unit.source: Sparse Columns
trans-unit.target: Sparse Columns

trans-unit.source: In sparse columns, all elements that correspond to background zeros are not processed in unary operations.
trans-unit.target: In sparse columns, all elements that correspond to background zeros are not processed in unary operations.

trans-unit.source: If one argument of a binary operation is a sparse column and the other argument is a dense one, the resulting column is sparse with all background zeros propagated from input from the sparse column.
trans-unit.target: If one argument of a binary operation is a sparse column and the other argument is a dense one, the resulting column is sparse with all background zeros propagated from input from the sparse column.
